messages.message:
You, at least would be interested in a hackerspace... right?
You, at least, *

Brian
maybe
what all would it entail?

maybe some dues for you know... paying the bills. But ideally not a ton.
I think it'd be great to offer at 20-30$ a month for maintenance etc.
but this all largely depends on the space
and the number of people invovled
involved*
I just remember you being like "Let's have a brain storming night!" and I think that was an awesome idea

Brian
except I am in phoenix now
and people are fucking stupid
in general
O_o

Brian
so I am not going to treat them to something like a nice place to work and hack shit without something in return

lol
well yeah, me neither 
like paying the fucking bills.

Brian
what did you have in mind?

find a reasonably sized space, create non-profit (with a board of directors), aim for tax-exemption for donations, network locally
participate in something like the art walk
to raise awareness of the group/space

Brian
I like it
accept memberships

Brian
too bad I live in Phoenix.
So yeah, you don't have to be a year long member - if you just want to use some of our stuff... but it'll cost you - and you need to be supervised.

Brian
yeah
sounds like fun

i've mentioned it to several people
and they just look at me like I'm retarded

Brian
hmm, I guess it would be easier to publicize ACM more for example. Use space owned by the university.
Also, people are fucking stupid

I'd really like to keep it free from the university
because I know there are a lot of brewers in ton
town*

Brian
yeah

and I'd like to possibly collaborate with them
and other sorts of things
I just don't think the university should have it's hand in it - with the exception of the university provides ripe recruiting
what's with the ultra negative attitude towards people btw?
something happen?
I mean, I agree too, but seems very slightly off for you.

Brian
hmm, you are correct sir.  Coming down off of my very tall ice tea.  Jessie and Mike just left.  Honestly I want to spend the rest of my life at a festival like Lightning in a Bottle.
I am depressed to be back to work.
what have you been up to?
Jessie and Mike just left? to where?

Brian
back to flag

ah
welp back to work
peace
